entry.title: Combined summary - MATT: [demo] Optimistic execution of arbitrary programs
entry.summary: The email I received discusses the implementation of the original MATT challenge protocol. It includes a link to a write-up that provides a detailed description of how to transform a "high-level arbitrary program" into something that can be verified on-chain in Bitcoin Script. The write-up also contains instructions on running the code and inspecting the transactions using a local block explorer.The implementation of the MATT challenge protocol utilizes two proposed opcodes: OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY and OP_CAT. These opcodes are used to trace the execution of a program called `multiply`. The goal is to challenge the computation of this program in O(n logn) on-chain transactions.However, the email does not provide any further details about the implementation or specific challenges faced during the process. It mainly serves as an introduction to the topic and directs readers to the write-up for more information.Here are the links provided in the email:[0] - Link to the original MATT challenge protocol: [insert link][1] - Link to the code for the `multiply` program: [insert link]
